page.title: 07BIOGRAPHY
page.content: These are some of the memories that the grandmother of one of our children told us. I lived in a lane which was very quiet with fields all round ,but now it is a large housing-estate.There was a dairy nearby and I used to collect two or three pennywoth of milk in a jug. Our house had four rooms and it was one of a group of six.Our lavatory was at the end of the garden and we shared it with our neighbour.There was only one water tap for the six houses and we had to collect it in buckets. I didn't have any regular pocket money,because my father was often ill and my mother had to work very hard. We were quite happy to play in the fields and have picnics. I didn't have many toys- a doll of course and my brother once made me a doll's pram from orange boxes painted bright green.
